meanings.definition: The loud, harsh cry of a donkey.
meanings.sent1: The brays of the donkey echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: I heard the brays of a donkey in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The brays of the donkey startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The brays of the donkey cut through the peaceful morning.
meanings.sent5: The brays of the donkey were unmistakable in the quiet countryside.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh cry like a donkey.
meanings.sent1: He brays loudly when he is excited.
meanings.sent2: The donkey brays whenever someone approaches the fence.
meanings.sent3: The comedian brays like a donkey in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: She brays with laughter at the silly joke.
meanings.sent5: The child brays with joy as he plays with his new toy.

meanings.definition: To crush or grind with a mortar and pestle.
meanings.sent1: She brays the spices to make a flavorful paste.
meanings.sent2: The chef brays the herbs to release their aroma.
meanings.sent3: Grandma brays the garlic for her famous pasta sauce.
meanings.sent4: The pharmacist brays the ingredients for the herbal remedy.
meanings.sent5: The baker brays the nuts for the crunchy topping.
